alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 9:49AM CDT until April 04 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRY...SCOTT AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 949 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Park View, or 7 miles north of Bettendorf, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... McCausland around 955 AM CDT. Le Claire and Princeton around 1000 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Camanche, Port Byron, Cordova, Low Moor, Princeton Wildlife Area, Rock Creek Park, Rock Creek Marina and Campground, Folletts, Clinton Municipal Airport and Clinton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
